name: Markdown cheat sheet
description: Markdown is a lightweight markup language with plain text formatting syntax designed so that it can be converted to HTML

Emphasis.val: Displays the text in bold and italics
Adds strikethrough effect to the text

Links.key: [I'm an inline-style link with title](https://www.google.com "Google's Homepage")
[I'm a reference-style link][Arbitrary case-insensitive reference text]
[You can use numbers for reference-style link definitions][1]
Links.val: Links with a reference number. The number eeds to be defined as [1]: http://slashdot.org

Images.val: The reference style. Reference need to be declared as [logo]: https://github.com/adam-p/markdown-here/raw/master/src/common/images/icon48.png "Logo Title Text 2"

Code and Syntax Highlighting.val: Inline code has back-ticks around it.
Blocks of code are either fenced by lines with three back-ticks or are indented with four spaces

Blockquotes.val: > Blockquotes are very handy in email to emulate reply text.

Inline HTML.val: You can use the raw HTML in your Markdown

Horizontal Rule.val: You can get a horizontal rule by typing three or more Hyphens or Asterisks or Underscores
